thread.title: PCM falls short in district battle with No. 1 Albia
thread.title_full: PCM falls short in district battle with No. 1 Albia

title: PCM falls short in district battle with No. 1 Albia
text:
PCM falls short in district battle with No. 1 Albia Published: Monday, Oct. 19, 2015 11:35 a.m. CDT By Troy Hyde Newton Daily News 
ALBIA — Class 2A No. 1 Albia rolled to another win, remained undefeated and locked up the top seed out of Class 2A District 7 with a 42-6 win over Prairie City-Monroe’s football team on Friday night. 
PCM (6-2, 4-1) had its six-game win streak snapped. The Mustangs will have to beat North Polk at home in the regular-season finale this Friday to earn the No. 2 seed and a first-round bye in the playoffs. 
Albia led 28-0 at halftime. 
The Mustangs’ only points of the game came on a 3-yard touchdown pass from Logan Gilman to Luke Greiner in the fourth quarter. 
Gilman was 17-of-32 for 169 yards and one interception. Greiner caught 10 passes for 112 yards and Noah Clark had three catches for 34 yards. 
Davis Herndon led the PCM defense with five solo tackles and nine assisted tackles, while Reid Jenkins had five solos and five assists. 
Carter Isley again led the Blue Demons. 
The all-state tailback and future Northern Iowa Panther wrestler had 178 rushing yards and two scores on 22 carries. He also caught a 73-yard touchdown pass and completed a pass for 10 yards. 
The 73-yard touchdown pass was the only completion on the night for Blake Bayer. 
The Albia defense had four sacks and held the Mustangs’ to negative-6 yards rushing. 
PCM’s regular season finale against North Polk (5-3, 4-1) will kickoff at 7:30 p.m. Friday in Monroe.
